Based on user preference cues, I would recommend "The White Countess" (2005) and "The Monuments Men" (2014) as they share similar themes and are highly rated by audiences.
"The White Countess" is a historical drama film about the life of Empress Cipriani della Rovere, an Italian noblewoman who lived in the late 19th century. The film tells her story from when she was born in Rome to the time when she passed away in Florence. The film stars Michelle Yeoh as Empress Cipriani della Rovere.
"The Monuments Men" is a historical drama film about the life of George S. Patton, an American military general who served as the Commanding General of the U.S. Army during World War II. The film tells his story from when he was born in Virginia to the time when he passed away in California. The film stars George Clooney as George S. Patton.
